author: henrik.metsamaki
title: Employment Credentials in Tanzania
description: Zanzibar and the wider Tanzania is becoming one of the hotspots for blockchain implementation through IOG and World Mobile, but this potential of people with DID's is only barely exploited

f6_assessments.q0:
Cardano needs adoption. Although utilizing NFT's would have potentially wider financial use cases. For NFT's are some extent also some form of DID's. Although DID's in the proposers understanding are equally interesting, DID's are more of a long-term effort to adopt Cardano. Nonetheless any effort to increase adoption is crucial.

Though this proposal does not speak of direct adoption per say, it does identify the needs to study the market on the necessity of having DID's. This I feel is a very sensible and pragmatic approach which needs to be understood by the larger Cardano community. You can't just expect to have superior technology and have it applied throughout a community. In terms of traction you actually need to have a product that is needed by the community. This is what essentially this team is trying to pinpoint through market research. Is DID's that compelling in Tanzania?

Any effort of adoption in Africa, especially driven by data and potentially partnering with a business entity that already uses Cardano will eventually create an ecosystem. Build on this ecosystem and the real-fi benefit it brings will naturally onboard more on to it.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team are seasoned individuals that have the essential background to conduct this market research. Key experiences that correlates directly with this proposal, is Product Development. Which the team lean and CCO has years of experience in. They have also provided their LinkedIn for further review by the Cardano community. What is provided in the LinkedIn only solidifies their capacity to conduct a proper market research.

This of course is carried through the approach of their market research in this proposal. Most important aspect of the market research is the duration, topic and target of the research. A minor critique is the number of participants of this research is a bit low, the only seek to interview 50 individuals. There is no mentioning of sampling a larger market.

Looking forward to the results of this market research. It can become a case study of what Cardano needs to launch first to a similar market. Should the focus of Cardano be on expanding the use case of NFT's or introducing DID's. As a gambling man, I would rather go for expanding the use case and the further understanding of NFT's.
f6_assessments.q2:
All the metrics needed are there. From a clear roadmap, detailed budget and also what they seek to achieve. Although it is a shame that a lot of the budget goes to traveling cost. This just underlines how Cardano is still not diverse enough. There is still a strong tendency towards relying on the minds of westerners. Perhaps it can be considered in the future to also involve more of the locals as a future attempt to explore being cost-effective in Africa.

Besides that though, the additional KPI's are a bit confusing. Since it is a market research I do not understand why there is a metric regarding number of successful recruitment using DID's. Is it not the function of this proposal is to determine deployment of their solution? Perhaps they are preparing for the future?

f6_assessments.q0: Great proposal and continuation of the previously funded 'Employment Credentials in Zanzibar' proposal from Fund8. The funding amount of USD$24500 is reasonable and the impact of this work with leveraging both world mobile and Atala PRISM is commendable. Verifying both education and employmnt is critical to enhancing your workforce with more reliable, trustworthy and honest actors and this approach is a great solution. Your breakdown of the main risks as identified well thought out an adequately considered.
f6_assessments.q1: It is obvious to me that the need for continued funding is typically required and in the spirit of adhering to community feedback, it is always valid to break your long term proposal vision into multipe parts and to attempt funding in subsequent funding rounds. You have done just that and as far as I can see your approach to taking the requisite time to study the various primary areas of attention like World Mobile and the market as well as analysing the data shows a dedication to ensuring a solid attempt at understanding your deliverables and audience. The various elements that you are looking to fund are reasonable and required for your vision. Your budget breakdown is thorough and is clear in it's explanation of what the funding amounts are being used for. Lastly, your team list is present and so I feel that this proposal ticks all the boxes.
f6_assessments.q2: It appears to me that you have the majority of the success metrics that I like to see as well as a suite of other milestone KPI's that will provide great measures to how you are both tracking and performing. Well done.

f6_assessments.q0:
The issue of getting peoples credentials onto the blockchain is an important one to be addressed. Work history is as yet not being focussed on by World Mobile or by IOHK that I'm aware of.

This is potentially harder than the community and IOHK first thought. The issue appears to be lack of base infrasctruture such as lack of internet, reliable power, lack of cellphone coverage and so on. This project does not address any of these issues and so will only be accessable to a small subset of people with reliable power and coverage until these other issues are resolved.
f6_assessments.q1:
The majority of the team listed is sales, marketing, leadership and management with only Mearaf Tadewos listing experience in developing in haskell and familiar with developing on Cardano. 

The proposers note that they have already been funded to create the credential and verification side of the project, and this proposal budget is entirely for a feasability study. With this in mind I do no see the reson for a 2-week 'pre-study' that is essentially just looking at World Mobile's credential system - which World Mobile have stated is using ATALA Prism. 
The pre-study also includes studying recruitment processes in Zanzibar and Tanzania which the team and then traveling to those places to study again. as well as a third party study. 

Although I believe this team can do the study, The funding and existance of the pre-study seems redundant, or poorly explained.
f6_assessments.q2:
The auditing and progress markers are essentially "a plan to make a plan", and the milestones for this study are not clear. 

However I realise that often with feasibility studies it can be hard to know what you will end up with and are exploratary in nature.

It would have been good to see a proposed release time for the report, or a road map from this study to finished product.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal aims to leverage on the partnership between IOG and World Mobile, which led to the creation of several digital identity profiles via Atala PRISM for users of World Mobile. 
More in detail, the digital ID created via this partnership would serve well as ID for other markets such as the job market. Currently in Zanzibar and Tanzania the job applications are still dealt via paper. Fairway, a Finnish company is offering to digitize the job application processes and the applicants profiles in the country by reapplying what has already been done in Ethiopia. 
I like this proposal because if combines prior knowledge from both the Atala PRISM chapter and the previous experience in another country. 
Digital identity has been adopted already by European countries to access national services like tax declaration, health insurance, pension records ect. following a top to bottom approach. This is a bottom to top approach, because it does not come from the government, but as in Europe the digital identity acted as a simplificator tool, this Finnish company is helping african people to adopt the same technology standards when it comes to verifiable identity.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project includes a first phase of testing the feasibility of the solution by studying the structure of the AtalaPRISM credentials. 
The collection of the digital identity will be done by WorldMobile as they aim to reach 100k new customers in Tanzania in Q1 of 2022.
The project also includes a phase of market research with a limited number of participants to understand the makret need in Zanzibar and the adaptation to be done from the Ethiopian study.
The final result will be a Proof of Employment -credentials for people employed in Zanzibar and Tanzania, available on the platform developed by Fairway.
I would suggest the team to investigate with a legal regarding privacy policies: World mobile should make the users tick a box to make the aware that the data will be shared in the future with Fairway to enable them being able to enroll in their platform and seek for job/register their employment status or offer a job. 
I believe the proposal can be delivered as it is not fully dependend of the funds received from catalyst and it would need some help to cover manily employees salaries and travel expenses. Moreover, Fairway has team members who have already dealt with Atala PRISM (pioneer program), have already established contacts in Tanzania and, as stated above, come from an experience in Ethiopia where they conducted a similar job.
f6_assessments.q2:
I love the graphical representation on the Miro  dahsboard, illustrating every single milestone to be reached with a deadline on the timeline. Also the block diagram that illustrates the use of the Digital Identity pulled from Atala and used for this project is pretty clear. 
Budget breakdown is detailed, the team is asking for around 24000 usd, which is a fair amount compared to the thousands of users who would benefit from the platform.
The only lack of information that I see here is how World mobile would be remunerated for the information shared, how ADA would be eventually used (to enroll into the platform or whenever a user credential is required by a company).
The team also would need to elaborate a backup plan in case World Mobile would not share the credentials of the users.

f6_assessments.q0:
Tanzania is one of the African countries, located in the eastern part on the continent, with a island region, called Zanzibar. As developing country, the unemployment rate is around 9.5% based on the 2020 World Bank data. This shows how employment is a challenge in Tanzania.
This proposal brings one of the solution to the unemployment by providing a system that helps job seekers to be identified and get connected to employers through the credentials production, and provide a proof of employment through the Fairway platform.
Zanzibar being a region that has gained a lot of recognition in Cardano Community due recent incredible developments by IOG and World Mobile represents an asset for future implementation of such an initiative, and this will help expand its use and recognition.
On another side, the initiative can start from Zanzibar and expand in other Tanzania regions, but also other African countries, and this is already proven with the current initiative taking place in Ethiopia, from which experience and learnings will help to implement the one in Zanzibar.
This proposal aligns with the challenge objectives as it facilitates the seed and adoption and expansion of Cardano in Africa.
f6_assessments.q1:
Being familiar with Africa, as myself from that continent, the big challenge I could have seen to implement this initiative, would have been the lack of internet connection, since a large part of Africa is not yet connected. But with the World Mobile service already operational in Zanzibar, which is a prerequisite on implementing the current proposal.
The 5 stages of this proposal implementation are well defined and described to allow readers to follow the different steps, however I would see this proposal to be divided in to two main phases. One being the research phase, during which the team would work on the first 4 stages, that include: pre-study, market study 1 & 2, and the post study (market study analysis report); and the second phase, that would be the project implementation. I raise this because the implementation is somehow conditional to the result of the market study as stated by proposers in the risks. (the adaptation level of PRISM DID's is still too low and/or the Credentials that the users of World Mobile get from using the service are difficult to utilize properly in the recruitment process). 
The Proposers team has been involved in a similar project in Ethiopia and is formed with people from various professional backgrounds related to this type of initiative.
The budget is detailed and a reasonable timeframe.
f6_assessments.q2:
It's clear that this proposal respond to a social need and provides a reasonable roadmap, and KPI's, that are measurable. The results of this proposal will allow businesses and job seekers to utilize DID and to issue and verify credentials through the platform, and this may be available on https://fairway.global
The doubt that may raise would be that the success of the proposal is conditional to the results of the market-study, which is a prior step.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a great proposal that offers an innovative solution to tackle a common challenge in the African continent. Verifying credentials is extremely necessary in recruitment processes but they can be a burden in Africa as it is difficult to be implemented because most of these verifications are paper-based and lack technological advances to make them more efficient. The solution designed by the startup Fairway is based on Atala PRISM based identity solution and their idea is to offer proof of employment and educational records as verifiable credentials in their platform in the form of a SaaS. In other words, the company is adding value to the Cardano ecosystem by creating a product that addresses a real problem faced by Africans and incentivizing new Africa-based users to join Cardano. The KPIs proposed, however, are not very precise and aligned with the challenge setting. For instance, they list "Engaged to a conversation with multiple job seeker segments in the markets" as a KPI but this is not objectively measurable nor very precisely constructed. Instead, they could pursue KPIs more aligned with the campaign such as local partnerships formed and number of Africa-based users onboarded onto Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal provides a brief introduction to each of the seven team members presented and also links to their LinkedIn profiles. Moreover, they also describe the type and number of the members that will be needed to implement the plan. The budget is reasonable and clearly identifies what will be the costs expected and where the funds will be redirected to. It is divided in four parts, the pre-study, the Zanzibar market study trip, the Tanzania market study trip and the post-study analysis and deployment plan. The timeline also follows a very similar division and dates are estimated for the conclusion of each phase. Overall, the plan is expected to be finished by the end of November of this year, which sounds realistic. Finally, the team has considered the potential risks of the project and properly identified the adaptation level of PRISM DID as the main one. That is because their business strategy revolves around the assumption that the credentials that the users of World Mobile get can be leveraged to be used in recruitment processes.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap provided by the team has clear milestones and they have estimated conclusion dates for each of the five phases designed in their plan. Some of the KPIs defined, however, are not very well-thought. For instance, the KPI "Published Feasibility report for the Cardano community" is more of a milestone than a KPI.  A better metric would be number of Africa-based users onboarded onto Cardano or user activity and reach of their platform. Nevertheless, the solution proposed is not only understandable but also effective in the sense that it solves a real-world problem in Africa through a product built on top of Cardano. Lastly, they have provided a public Miro board that tracks the progress of the team, which is great for auditability.

f6_assessments.q0: Through the team's presentation, I see this as a promising opportunity for blockchain developers to implement through IOG and World Mobile. The team is seizing this opportunity to execute a solution to issue and verify credentials for a better recruitment market in Tanzania and Zanzibar and form a deployment plan. This means quite a lot for businesses and people who need jobs, especially for businesses - where there is a great need for labor. Surely the recruitment market in Tanzania and Zanzibar will be much more exciting if this proposal is implemented. I think that has a big impact on the goal of the Challenge. It is because it uses Cardano blockchain technology through IOG and World Mobile that it will increase the value of the Cardano ecosystem. I find that this confirms the photo impact of the proposal. If done well, I believe the team can completely scale up and tackle bigger challenges in the future. The problem that needs to be solved in Tanzania is the same problem that needs to be solved elsewhere across Africa. Therefore, I fully consider this proposal as a model that can be applied in many places in Africa and other continents (provided that the proposal must have good results when implemented in practice).
f6_assessments.q1: The team has been very professional and the full range of expertise is reflected in one of the team's websites, Fairway. global and Fairway. work. This professionalism is not achieved by many other teams. The number of team members, the full professional expertise plus the clear publicity, and the link to the Linkedin social network make me confident in the feasibility of the proposal. This is an important factor to help you increase the trust of the community. In terms of budget, allocated implementation of each step of the proposal. But I need the team to explain in more detail about "Post-study analysis and deployment plan". Because this factor is related to research and it will be good if you explain carefully the technical aspects of technology, the language used when implementing. Doing so will increase the persuasiveness of the proposal. That is also my advice for the feasibility of the proposal. Regarding the challenge risk, I would like to highlight one factor that you mentioned in the proposal. That is: the current job market is not ready for digital services and document processing. This is worth looking closely at, because in general, the African business and labor market is still growing, if not much more backward than the labor markets in the continents. other. Should be digitally accessible - advanced information technology is a big deal. I urge you to consider this risk very carefully. To be able to deploy the proposal very smoothly when it is eligible for practical application.
f6_assessments.q2: I was impressed with the timeline that the team outlined in the proposal. The proposal team has laid out a roadmap with easily verifiable milestones. Along with that is clearly describing the problem and clearly stating the solution to solve the problem. This speaks to the meticulous investment of the team when writing the proposal. The metrics and KPIs for defining success are present and very specific. It contains both technical and non-technical content that is convenient for the community to review. However, I would like to see some of the KPIs more clearly. For example, specific indicators for "Engaged in a conversation with multiple job seeker segments in the markets"; "Published Feasibility report for the Cardano community"; "Deployment plan created with a clear timeline and customer segments". Teams should set goals with a certain number of the criteria listed above, not just if each criterion doesn't have a specific number attached. Because the more KPIs/Metrics you get, the more the community appreciates the Auditability of the proposal. From there, it is more convenient the implementation the proposal. Anyway, I liked the team's proposal, it was carefully invested. That's why I vote 5 stars for audibility.

f6_assessments.q0: In an event where new technologies from Africa are launched on the blockchain or use cardano blockchain particularities to solve pressing problem it become a great win for the catalyst community since we need more active developers over passive ones. Though the proposal addresses the challenge in the adoption of blockchain technology, the team is not demonstrating how the employment credentials could benefit catalyst in the short to medium term.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has the experience in product development and software programming and equally have the ability create functional blockchain credentials. The proposal seems to focus on conducting a market analysis report to determine the readiness of the technology before deployment. Because of that, the proposal's plan of action is on the survey over the development and deployment of the technology. There's also no clear timelines for each of the milestone to monitor progress of the project. 

This has made the budget to allocate only 16% of the total budget sum to the deployment. I am also confuse to conduct two different market surveys for the whole of Tanzania and another one for Zanzibar. This will swallow up the budget from the  deployment of the blockchain technology itself. 

This depict that, the team may not be able to deliver on the project for success. 

The team also did not provide enough details on the budget allocated for the technology deployment.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPIs provided by the team clear with expected outcomes. Especially, there is is metric to measure the number of businesses onboarded to use the technology. This will help the community to audit the proposal's progress. The KPIs are therefore measurable and can be evaluated.

f6_assessments.q0: Yes, this proposal very effectively addresses the challenge and would represent Tanzania in africa well. I really like the presentation and thought that went into this proposal. they definitely put a lot of hard work into thinking it through. Cardano needs to be adopted in Africa this proposal would help that goal. Goals are clearly laid out to establish Cardano-based credentials in recruitment of companies. Since they are located in Africa already there is no one better to do this job.
f6_assessments.q1: Yes, The proposers have previous experience that would help them be successful in this project. The team is well documented there previous work and accomplishments. The plan is easy to understand and the DID adoption is exactly what Cardano needs. I gave this proposal a perfect score in this section because it was done really well. The picture features the team with Charles Hokinson which is from his trips there. This shows the teams interest and participation within the Cardano community and is also valuable.
f6_assessments.q2: Yes, the information in this proposal shows exactly where the funds are to be used and will document all relevant data publicly. They clearly and concisely lay out what success for the project looks like. This is a good example of a really well done proposal and has received a perfect score from me. The KPI are exactly on point and in line with this projects stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement described by the proposer fits into the challenge category. Adoption is key to any blockchain and Cardano is not an exception. With large suite of real world usage applications provided by Cardano,  these project intends to provide an easy passage to employability in Africa.

The project seek to leverage the Cardanos' own Atala Prism DIDs and verifiable credentials to provide and issue  proof of employment onchain to individuals. The project pose itself as a startup that provides Software as a Service (SaaS) to developing markets across Africa. Proof of Employment credentials can play a big role for people in various fronts like loans, insurance etc as it will serve as a trustscore for individuals.

Owing to the fact that the project is tied to DIDs, it is however posed with the risk that if Atala Prism adoption is low or hindered, the project might also delay but team proposes to mitigate such risk by being dynamic in it's operations and can always restrategize.
f6_assessments.q1:
Team provided me with detailed roadmap outlining their pre study done by studying world mobile credential framework, study Zanzibar recruitment market, market study, post study and deployment plan. All details provided are satisfactory. Furthermore, the proposer provides timeline that will commence immediately (if funded) and will last till end of November with notable milestones.

The requested budget amount is reasonable but some items in the budget breakdown seems vague. Items like Salary costs (should say who is being paid, for what service and for how long). Travel cost (Travel from where and to where and how many people are transported). Expected two weeks of work from two people : $4000 (should indicate who those two people are and what work they are or will do for such payment).

The proposal avail me detailed information about team members and their respective role/expertise in the project with verifiable links. Furthermore, there's no clarity as to if the project will come for additional funding or not as this is a continuation of an already funded proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer provided me with relevant information and KPI which can be used to track progress and success of the project and the KPIs are categorized as before deployment and after deployment. So there is notable measure of progress in the proposal like number of FIDs registered on their platform, number of proof of employment issued.

The metrics chisen and presented are  good indicators for measuring success and progress.

f6_assessments.q0:
The issue is appropriate zanzibar and broader Tanzania is becoming one of the hot spots for blockchain implementation through IOG and World Mobile
Solving this challenge presents this potential of people with DID that is almost exclusively tapped
Identify risk problems and challenges in the real world credential verification for better recruitment markets in Tanzania and Zanzibar . This development brings local technology to a new era with completely improved internet connectivity and also with Atala PRISM based identity solution made available to internet users and operators World New mobile. The project tackles the challenge effectively.
f6_assessments.q1:
Clear and logical progress on milestones Integrate PRISM into our recruitment platform to verify effective education for recruitment businesses as part of the recruitment process
The required budget is detailed, reasonable, clear, and transparent
This project includes a market study, a research report for the community and an implementation plan.
Team capacity has the potential to have relevant experience, I think this project has the potential to supply the market
we provide a Feasibility Report to the Cardano community so similar projects planning to build on these systems get value from it
Deployment plan for our technology. We set up a timeline, first customer segments, cities and demographics, and a ready-to-market credential framework. I hope this project is funded good luck tomorrow
f6_assessments.q2:
High project success metrics Deployment plan created with clear schedule and customer segmentation
Having clear actual creation of additional KPIs after implementation, we will roll out our implementation to bring more users to Cardano's DID ecosystem
Yes it fits the challenge and the whole proposal we will roll out our implementation to bring more users to Cardano's DID ecosystem.
Make it possible for Job Seekers to use their Cardano-based login in recruiting and employees will receive job information issued through the software

f6_assessments.q0: The world is increasingly evolving with numerous modern technologies that make people's lives more and more convenient. And with the spirit of sharing, those technologies will be transmitted everywhere in the world, from developed to developing countries, in one way or another. However, certain regions still exist where people "possess the property but don't know how to use it." This Fairway initiative addresses that need in Zanzibar. The proposal depicts the actual situation here, with the fantastic development of IOG and World Mobile, but individuals are unsure how to capitalize on it. Fairway intends to focus the project on recruiting and job search and use the complete recruitment SaaS to assist people's exposure to Cardano. I enjoyed the proposer's content being presented simply and comprehensively, with all the critical information linked to introducing the solution, describing the link between the project and the challenge, and the potential key dangers. However, there is one thing in the proposal that continues to perplex me: you stated that your proposal Recruitment Using Atala PRISM has been passed and is under construction, but I notice it still appearing in the challenge Dapps, Products & Integrations of this fund 9. So, what exactly do you mean by "passed"? Please clarify further.
f6_assessments.q1: As a team whose project is in the government phase, your team knows what needs to be done, when, and how. Your roadmap is detailed, with each activity correctly classified and a detailed explanation of the activity's purpose. In addition, the budget is thoroughly constructed from cost components for four significant operations (Credentials and creating product implementation strategy analyst Henrik & Gemechis, Zanzibar market study trip, Tanzania market study trip, Post-study analysis, and deployment plan). Your project team has a diverse range of talented individuals, so it's not surprising that you take everything seriously and thoroughly. However, because this is a new change in this fund 9, I find a lot of proposals missing this area; please clarify further on the management workload when you respond yes to the question "Are you or any member of your team working on any other proposals in this Fund9?"
f6_assessments.q2: You're still in good form in this final section, showing KPIs related to this project and the complete implementation phase after successful market research. I'm especially pleased with the specific quantitative figures you provide so that the community may track the success of the project's development. With careful planning and investment, I think Fairway's future orientation will be fulfilled and deliver the most suitable benefits to the Tanzania and Zanzibar recruitment markets.

f6_assessments.q0: Zanzibar , a semiautonomous territory in Tanzania, is reportedly exploring ways to regulate and adopt cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin. The government of Zanzibar is planning to conduct meetings with stalkholders like banks and ministries to discuss policies related to cryptocurrency industry. As there is no proper way to onboard them the people with DID's is barely exploited. Verifying the credentials for better recruitment market in Tanzania and Zanzibar and testing feasibility of solution to form a deployment plan. This proposal effectively addresses the challenge and I agree with the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The metrics provided clearly align with proposal goal and timeline. The road map given is achievable which has prestudy, market study has third party provider, post study analysis and feasibility report and also has deployment plan for the technology. The timeline begins once the funding is secured and continues till September and is going to happen in 3 stages . The last stage ends in around one month. I quite strongly agree with the budget outline, it is clearly broken down into idenfiable terms. Given experiences and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPI's given has good information regarding the project which can surely make the proposal a heavy weight in this challenge and also apt for easy monitoring of implementation and overall success. The roadmap has provided detailed plan including various studies and analysis. The timeline begins in different stages which are the milestones for delivering the proposal. The budget  plan can be implemented easily and successfully. The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and success of proposal

f6_assessments.q0:
The team has done a lovely job by looking to the proposal in it's right challenge. The proposal in it's effectively addressed the challenge and has potential of bringing values to the Cardano ecosystem and African countries.
     The proposal team clearly provide a precise solution to the stated problem by indicating how they has gained a lot of recognition in the Cardano community due to recent incredible development by 10G and World Mobile internet which I strongly believe is commerciabl to be granted funds to execute their project.the proposal also capture some important key metrics under the compaign brief such as, integrating PRISM to recruitment platform to verify education efficiently for recruiting business as part of recruitment process which address the challenge in the Cardano ecosystem and African countries and I strongly believe they will do a great job should they be funded to execute their project
f6_assessments.q1: The team has able to provide links to the teams members who will help in the execution of their project. The proposal team has the effective desire skills and experience to be able to execute their project following their links which I strongly believe is commerciabl. Furthermore the proposal team has done well by outlining the break down of budget on how funds will be used should they be funded and the timely rata they will use to execute their project. The team also able to outline the milestone and roadmap course structure for delivery their project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal team is able to provide clear outline on how to measure the progress of their project and how success will look like should they be funded by elaborating on some of the key metrics to look out for such as, bringing more user to Cardano DID ecosystem, increased the potential of other business to adopt this technology which I strongly believe will do a great job should they be funded.
Furthermore, the proposal also indicate how success and progress of their project will be measure to Cardano ecosystem through report from community based.

f6_assessments.q0:
i am a bit confused as to how this idea aligns well with this challenge, no direct ways  in the solution given were provided in my view to provide that win win scenario for both the cardano ecosystem and Africa. This makes the impact i believe this proposal will have on the cardano ecosytem is quite minimal.



Moreover, the explanation to some of the activities provided were abit confusing as stated  in the market study (2) as a similar feasibility study would have been abit clearer  if the activities to take place in that study were provided.
f6_assessments.q1:
I disagree to the successful implementation of this proposal, in as much as proposers are introducing a service in SaaS already in Ethiopia, I think the information provided to mitigate the challenges and risk that are likely to be encountered will see to the projects safe delivery.




Moreover, detailed description of the timelines for implementation to my opinion was not very clear. For example using statements such as "around five months" casts a little bit of doubt since in-depth feasibility studies was not seen to be carried out
f6_assessments.q2:
I disagree to the successful evaluation of the success of this proposal, given some of the information provided in the KPIs, i have a doubt concerning whether those indicators can be evaluated. Examples include, engagement in conversation  with job seekers, i think will be abit difficult to measure and report on accordingly.




Moreover, information on process through which progress will be measured as well as specific timelines to report progress to the cardano community was not really outlined into details.

This casts a little doubt on the successful evaluation of the key outcomes of this proposal. I suggest future proposals ill have to include this information to assist voters.

f6_assessments.q0:
The project clearly stated the problem that there aren´t any verified credential on the job market. This lowers the trust between applicant and employer because credentials can be easily faked. The problem is real because the employer wants to get the best employee and when their experience is dubious it´s hard to decide. Therefore this could be good for the employer and qualified employees. 
Through investments from IOG and World Mobile is the technical capacity to implement this in Zanzibar and Tanzania. The project could help the people there by giving the employee a verified certificate for their experience made and the employer real proof of their previous experience. This could make the jobmarket more efficient, allocate experienced and good workers to the best workplaces and thus make the companies more effective. 
The proposal includes just the research on whether there is a viable option to deploy it there. The research will be made by market studies and an included deployment plan. This is the groundwork for the later usability in Africa. 
The proposal clearly matches the challenge because it improves the African jobmarket.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has provided some info about their job experience and their LinkedIn profiles. I also checked their LinkedIn and their experience looks matching for this proposal. Therefor they should have the skills to implement the proposal successfully. 
The budget was described clear. There are four different phases. First a pre-study, Zanzibar market study trip, Tanzania market study trip and a post-study and the deployment plan. The price for each is fair. 
The timeline was well described. It´s understandable and they have specified their tasks. The tasks are all reasonable to research the informations.
f6_assessments.q2:
The KPIs and success metrics are well chosen and clearly easy to measure because most of them are numeric and thus easy to evaluate. 
The overall roadmap is clear and they plan after the research is also outlined. 
All in all the keyproblem was stated and the proposal makes the foundation for solving it. The proposal creates additional information on which they can build an application.

solution: We test the feasibility of our solution to issue and verify credentials for a better recruitment market in Tanzania and Zanzibar and form a deployment plan. We'll also publish a report of our findings
experience:
Fairway:

Is introducing this service in their SaaS already in Ethiopia
Has good connections and Finnish partners in Tanzania
Consists of graduates of PRISM Pioneer Program
Has done similar market assessments in Ethiopia before
